summary: About 17 percent of adults in the U.S. have chronic kidney disease. If this disease progresses to kidney failure, patients need dialysis or a kidney transplant to stay alive. In 2013, Medicare spent nearly $31 billion to treat patients whose kidneys had failed. Given the high costs of this disease, we looked at how the federal government funds and prioritizes its research. We found that...
title: National Institutes of Health: Kidney Disease Research Funding and Priority Setting
